metrics.name: Soil Health Practices
metrics.description:
Indicates which sustainable agriculture best practices the organization implemented to maintain and enhance soil health of agricultural lands during the reporting period.

Select all that apply:

- Application of regionally appropriate soil health improvement practices to maintain or enhance soil fertility and the physical and biological characteristics of soil
- Monitoring of those soil health characteristics, including nutrients from different sources, that are necessary to maintain or enhance appropriate nutrient balance and soil health
- Development and maintenance of an up-to-date nutrient management program that efficiently uses nutrient inputs and nutrients in the soil and crops to create optimum conditions for production and avoids nutrient loss to water and air
- Other (describe)
- Undisclosed Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including descriptions of soil health practices and methods used, their frequency of application, description of soil health characteristics, and details of nutrient management plans.

metrics.name: Land Directly Controlled: Cultivated
metrics.description: Area of land directly controlled by the organization and under cultivation. Report directly controlled land area cultivated during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details about the nature of the direct control relationship and all assumptions used, including source of data. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Land Directly Controlled: Treated with Pesticides
metrics.name_kr: Land Directly Controlled: Treated with Pesticides
metrics.description: Area of land directly controlled by the organization and treated with pesticides. Report directly controlled land area treated during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details on the area of land directly controlled, disaggregated by the hazard level of pesticides used, as listed by the World Health Organization’s (WHO) Acute Toxicity Hazard Categories. Organizations should also footnote the source of data. See glossary term and usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Land Directly Controlled: Total
metrics.description: Area of land directly controlled by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details about the nature of the direct control relationship and all assumptions used, including source of data. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Soil Conservation Practices
metrics.description:
Indicates which soil conservation practices the organization implemented during the reporting period.

Select all that apply:

- Application of regionally appropriate practices to minimize disturbance of and physical damage to soil, cropland, and pasturelands
- Prevention of soil erosion, acidification, salinization, and accumulation of adverse compounds not otherwise specified
- Other (describe) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including descriptions of soil health practices and methods used, their frequency of application, description of soil health characteristics, and details of nutrient management plans.

metrics.name: Indigenous Rights and Stewardship Practices
metrics.description: Describes the practices used by the organization to acknowledge and support the traditional knowledge, innovations, and practices of local Indigenous communities and enable their customary use of biological resources on land, freshwater, and marine areas managed directly and indirectly by the organization. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used as well as the degree to which the organization partners with local Indigenous people to conduct business activities.
metrics.unit: Number of Metric Tons of CO2 Equivalent

metrics.name: Land Directly Controlled: Sustainably Managed
metrics.description: Area of land directly controlled by the organization and under sustainable cultivation or sustainable stewardship. Organizations should footnote details about the nature of the direct control relationship and all assumptions used, including source of data. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Pesticide Hazard Classification Type
metrics.description:

- Class Ib Highly hazardous 
- Class II Moderately hazardous 
- Class III Slightly hazardous 
- Class U Unlikely to present acute hazard

metrics.name: Species Conservation Status
metrics.description:
Describes the conservation status of species during the reporting period. 


Choose all that apply: 

- Least concern
- Near threatened
- Vulnerable
- Endangered
- Critically endangered
- Extinct in the wild
- Extinct
- Data deficient
- Not evaluated Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data.

metrics.name: Biodiversity Footprint
metrics.description: Describes the organization’s biodiversity footprint -- a measure of ecosystem intactness – on area directly or indirectly controlled by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details on their or their product’s biodiversity footprint and how it was assessed, including all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Species: Total
metrics.description: Indicates the number of different species (species richness) present within the area managed directly or indirectly by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data.

metrics.name: Species Abundance
metrics.description: Indicates the number of individuals of a particular species that are present on area directly or indirectly controlled by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data.

metrics.name: Number of Threatened Species
metrics.description: Number of threatened species present on land directly controlled by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source(s) of data.

metrics.name: Threatened Species Policy
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization implements policies to protect threatened species that reside in habitats affected by the organization's operations. Organizations should footnote details of their policies, how the threatened species are being affected and what is being done to protect them, and how organizations determine which habitats are affected by the organization's operations. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Biodiversity Assessment
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization has undertaken biodiversity-related assessments to evaluate the biological diversity and ecosystem condition present on the land that is directly or indirectly controlled by the organization. Organizations should footnote details about what the assessments evaluate. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Value of Carbon Credits Purchased
metrics.description: Value of carbon credits purchased by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote relevant details on the carbon credits purchased. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Greenhouse Gas Emissions Reduced
metrics.description: Amount of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions reduced by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including detailed information on calculation methodology. See usage guidance for further information.
metrics.unit: Number of Metric Tons of CO2 Equivalent

metrics.name: Greenhouse Gas Emissions Mitigated
metrics.description: Amount of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions mitigated by the organization during the reporting period, including GHG emissions reductions from both direct and indirect sources. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including detailed information on calculation methodology and source of data. See usage guidance for further information.
metrics.unit: Number of Metric Tons of CO2 Equivalent

metrics.unit: Number of Metric Tons of CO2 Equivalent

metrics.name: Traceability System

metrics.name: Energy Conservation Strategy

- Non-recycled compostable or renewable materials

Terrestrial Ecoregions

- Temperate broadleaf and mixed forests
- Temperate coniferous forest

- Flooded grasslands and savannas

metrics.name: Greenhouse Gas Emissions of Product
metrics.description: Amount of greenhouse gases (GHG) emitted by a product over its lifetime. Organizations should use Product Lifetime (PD4587) to capture the lifetime of the product. Organizations should footnote all assumptions and tools used in emissions calculation, including source of data.

metrics.name: Packaging Weight
metrics.description: Weight of packaging used by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Greenhouse Gas Emissions Sequestered
metrics.description: Amount of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions sequestered by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including detailed information on calculation methodology and source of data. See usage guidance for further information.
metrics.unit: Number of Metric Tons of CO2 Equivalent

metrics.name: Primary Energy Source
metrics.description:
Describes the primary source(s) for energy produced, sold, or purchased by the organization during the reporting period, or disaggregates another metric in terms of the primary source of the related amount of energy.

Select all that apply:

- Non-renewable sources:

Coal
Crude oil derivatives
Natural gas
Other (write-in)

Biomass
Geothermal
Hydro energy
Solar
Wind
Other (write-in)

Nuclear

metrics.name: Units/Volume Replaced
metrics.description: Number of status-quo products that were replaced by products sold during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data and nature of product replaced.

metrics.name: Renewable Energy Expenditures
metrics.description: Amount of money spent by the organization for renewable energy infrastructure and technology to produce energy intended for consumption at the organization's operating facilities during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the type of expenditures made and details on the energy sources to be used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Energy Capacity of Products Sold
metrics.description: Amount of energy potentially generated over the lifetime of products sold by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the energy type(s) and all assumptions used to determine the energy capacity.

metrics.name: Energy Capacity of Product
metrics.description: Amount of energy potentially generated over the lifetime of a product based on its planned operation and context. Organizations should footnote the energy type(s) and all assumptions used to determine the energy capacity.

metrics.name: Energy Capacity
metrics.description: Maximum amount of energy that the organization’s system can transmit (measured in kV) as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Energy Storage Device Cycle Life
metrics.description: Number of cycles that the organization’s energy storage product can be charged and discharged over its lifetime as of the end of the reporting period, measured as cumulative energy (MWh or MJ). Organizations should footnote the method used for estimating the cycle life, the scope of technology to which this metric applies, and all other assumptions used.

metrics.name: Energy Savings from Services Sold
metrics.description: Amount of energy savings due to the organization's services that were sold during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Energy Consumption of Product Replaced
metrics.description: Amount of energy that would have been consumed by the replaced product during the lifetime of the organization's product. Organizations should footnote details on the product replaced, source for data on product utilization, and any other assumptions.

metrics.name: Energy Consumption of Product
metrics.description: Amount of energy consumed by the product during its lifetime. Organizations should footnote assumptions used with respect to product utilization. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Energy Storage Capacity
metrics.description: Maximum amount of energy that can be stored in the organization’s energy storage product (in MWh or MJ) as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including the scope of technology to which this metric applies.

metrics.name: Energy Discharge Rate
metrics.description: Average discharge rate of the organization’s storage product , measured as the energy storage capacity divided by the discharge time, during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including the scope of technology to which this metric applies.

metrics.name: Energy Stored
metrics.description: Amount of energy stored by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Energy Discharged
metrics.description: Amount of energy discharged (MWh or MJ) from the organization’s energy storage product during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including the scope of technology to which this metric applies.

metrics.name: Energy Demand Hours Type
metrics.description:
Describes the time frame in which the organization operated during the reporting period.

Choose all that apply: 
- Peak 
- Off-Peak 
- Undisclosed 
- Other (describe) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Target Stakeholder Spending: Connectivity
metrics.description: Amount of money spent by an average target stakeholder on connectivity costs during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the type of expenditures made, as well as source of data and all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Energy Generated for Sale: Non-Renewable
metrics.description: Amount of non-renewable energy generated and sold to offtaker(s) during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the non-renewable energy type(s) and all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Product Hours of Light Available
metrics.description: Number of hours of light available from the product during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions made, especially those regarding product utilization. An example of such an assumption includes watts/hour used.

metrics.name: Length of Transmission Lines Built or Improved
metrics.name_kr: Length of Transmission Lines Built or Improved
metrics.description: Length of transmission lines built or improved by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Energy Transmitted: Total
metrics.description: Amount of energy transmitted by the organization during the reporting period (in MWh). Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Target Stakeholder Spending: Energy
metrics.description: Amount of money spent by the average target stakeholder on sources of energy during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the type of expenditures made, as well as details of energy sources used. Organizations should also footnote all other assumptions used, including source of data.

metrics.name: Energy Generated for Sale: Renewable
metrics.description: Amount of renewable energy generated and sold to offtaker(s) during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the renewable energy type(s) and all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Energy Savings from Products Sold
metrics.description: Amount of energy savings over the lifetime of products sold by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Energy Generated for Sale: Total
metrics.description: Amount of energy generated and sold to offtaker(s) during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the energy type(s) and all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Energy Capacity Added
metrics.description: Amount of new energy capacity connected to the grid during the reporting period, measured in MW. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Green Product/Service Type
metrics.description:
Describes how a product/service provided by the organization contributes to a more environmentally sustainable economy, or disaggregates another metric in terms of how the related product or service contributes to a more environmentally sustainable economy.

Select all that apply:
- Climate change mitigation
- Climate change adaptation
- The sustainable use and protection of water and marine resources 
- The transition to a circular economy
- Pollution prevention and control
- The protection and restoration of biodiversity and ecosystems
- Product/service does not contribute to a more environmentally sustainable economy
- Other (write-in) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data or disaggregation and any other disaggregations applied.
metrics.unit: Number of Metric Tons of CO2 Equivalent

metrics.name: Average Daily Traffic
metrics.description: Average number of vehicles per day using an urban road over the course of a year. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source(s) of data.

metrics.name: Forest Management Plan
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization implements a forest management plan. Organizations should footnote the relevant details about their forest management plan. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Type of Land Area
metrics.description:
Describes the type(s) of land present on hectares directly or indirectly controlled by the organization. Report for hectares controlled at any point during the reporting period. 
Choose all that apply: 
- Urban/built-up land
- Agricultural land 
- Rangeland 
- Forest land 
- Water areas 
- Wetland 
- Barren land 
- Tundra 
- Perennial snow or ice Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Ecosystem Services Provided
metrics.description:
Describes the ecosystem services—that is, the societal benefits of nature—provided by the ecosystem on land or marine area directly or indirectly controlled by the organization during the reporting period. Select all that apply:

Provisioning Values/Services

- Food
- Biological raw materials
- Biomass fuel
- Freshwater
- Genetic resources
- Biochemicals, natural medicines, pharmaceuticals

Regulating Values/Services

- Maintenance of air quality
- Regulation of climate
- Regulation of water timing and flows
- Erosion control
- Water purification and waste treatment
- Disease mitigation
- Maintenance of soil quality
- Pest mitigation
- Pollination
- Natural hazard mitigation

Supporting Values/Services

- Habitat
- Nutrient cycling
- Primary production
- Water cycling

Cultural Values/Services

- Recreation and ecotourism
- Ethical and spiritual values
- Educational and inspirational values Organizations should footnote details about their selections. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Conservation Priority Characteristics
metrics.description: Length of protected land boundary shared with the organization's protected land as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details about their selections. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Area of Land Deforested
metrics.description: Area of land deforested by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the reasons and methods for deforestation, as well as all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Length of Adjacent Protected Land
metrics.description: Length of protected land boundary shared with the organization's protected land as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Length of Coastline Restored
metrics.description: Length of marine or freshwater coastline under management for ecological restoration on protected land, land under sustainable stewardship, or land under sustainable cultivation during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as relevant ecological restoration activities undertaken during the reporting period.

metrics.name: Length of Streams Present
metrics.description: Length of freshwater streams present during the reporting period on protected land, land under sustainable stewardship, or land under sustainable cultivation. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Area of Trees Planted: Native Species
metrics.name_kr: Area of Trees Planted: Native Species
metrics.description: Area of land on which the organization planted native species of trees during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Protected Land Area: Permanent
metrics.description: Area of land with permanently protected status as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the methods applied to ensure protected land status. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Area of Trees Planted: Total
metrics.description: Area of land on which the organization planted trees during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Protected Land Area: Total
metrics.description: Area of land with protected land status as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the methods applied to ensure protected land status. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Area of Land Reforested
metrics.description: Area of land that the organization reforested during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Area of Adjacent Protected Land
metrics.description: Area of protected land that shares a boundary with the organization's protected land as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Length of Coastline Present
metrics.description: Length of marine or freshwater coastline present during the reporting period on protected land, land under sustainable stewardship, or land under sustainable cultivation. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Length of Streams Restored
metrics.description: Length of freshwater streams under management for ecological restoration on protected land, land under sustainable stewardship, or land under sustainable cultivation during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as relevant ecological restoration activities undertaken during the reporting period.

metrics.name: Area of Fresh Water Bodies Present
metrics.name_kr: Area of Fresh Water Bodies Present
metrics.description: Surface area of freshwater bodies present during the reporting period on protected land, land under sustainable stewardship, or land under sustainable cultivation. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Ecological Restoration Management Area
metrics.description: Area of land under management for ecological restoration during the reporting period, whether directly or indirectly controlled by the organization. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as relevant ecological restoration activities undertaken during the reporting period.

metrics.name: Length of Coastline Protected
metrics.description: Total length of coastal areas brought under official protection status or subject to formal conservation measures (such as coastal buffer zones, community-led conservation agreements, or enforcement of no-development zones) as a result of the organization’s activities. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Area of Seaweed Farm Certified
metrics.description: Total area of seaweed farming operations certified by a recognized third-party sustainability or environmental standard as a result of the organization’s activities. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Sustainable Livelihood Opportunities Supported
metrics.description: The number of individuals or households whose livelihood activities, income-generating pursuits, or productive assets have been supported, improved, or sustained through the organization's interventions during the reporting period. This may include support for employed or self-employed individuals, farmers, fishers, artisans, small business owners, or those involved in informal or community-based work Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Marine Environmental Pressures
metrics.description: Indicates natural and human-induced pressures faced by marine environments. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Area of Marine Habitat Protected
metrics.description: Total surface area of marine habitats newly designated as Marine Protected Areas (MPAs), or new habitats added to an existing MPA network, as a result of the organization’s activities. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Area of Marine Habitat Restored
metrics.description: Total surface area of marine habitats that have undergone restoration activities. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Restoration Success Rate
metrics.description: Percentage of restored areas that show measurable improvements in biodiversity, ecosystem function, or resilience post-restoration (e.g., survival rate of transplanted corals or re-established seagrass coverage). Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Marine Livelihoods
metrics.description: Sustainable livelihood options made available to coastal communities that are primarily dependent on the ocean and coastal ecosystems. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Marine Biodiversity Assessment
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization has undertaken biodiversity-related assessments to evaluate the biological diversity and ecosystem condition present on the coastal area and marine habitat that is directly or indirectly controlled by the organization. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Loss of Marine Habitat
metrics.description: Total surface area of marine or coastal habitat lost, including both direct destruction and unrestored degradation, as a result of the financed activity, such as coastal infrastructure development, dredging, seabed mining, aquaculture, or other marine and coastal land use changes. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Species Recovery
metrics.description: The annual percentage change in the population size of a target species within a defined area, compared to a scientifically established baseline. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Volume of Plastic Removed
metrics.description: The total volume of plastic waste physically removed or diverted from natural environments, such as aquatic, marine, terrestrial, or urban ecosystems, through clean-up activities, waste interception infrastructure, or other interventions. This includes macroplastics and microplastics collected before entering or while present in these environments. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Toxic Materials
metrics.description: Amount of toxic materials used in the organization's manufacturing processes during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Waste Produced: Hazardous Waste
metrics.description: Amount of hazardous waste created by the organization's operations during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Waste Disposed: Recycled/Reused
metrics.description: Amount of waste disposed by the organization through reuse and recycling during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Recycled Materials
metrics.description: Amount of recycled material used in the organization's products (including packaging) during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Waste Disposed: Landfill
metrics.description: Amount of waste disposed by the organization in landfills during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Biodegradable Materials
metrics.description: Amount of biodegradable materials used in the organization’s products (including packaging) during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Waste Disposed: Total
metrics.description: Amount of waste disposed by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including the type(s) of waste disposed.

metrics.name: Product Lifecycle Management Practices
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization has practices in place to manage products over their life beyond the point of sale. Organizations should footnote the details about their product lifecycle management practices. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Waste Produced: Total
metrics.description: Amount of waste created by the organization's operations during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including the type(s) of waste produced.

metrics.name: Waste Produced: Non-Hazardous Waste
metrics.description: Amount of non-hazardous waste created by the organization's operations during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Waste Reduced
metrics.description: Amount of waste reduced by the organization during the reporting period through programs for substitution, recycling, or recovery. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Waste Disposed: Incinerated
metrics.description: Amount of waste disposed by the organization through incineration during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Waste Disposed: Other
metrics.description: Amount of waste disposed by the organization through other means during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as the specific means of disposal.

metrics.name: Waste Disposed: Composted
metrics.description: Amount of waste disposed by the organization through composting during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Percent Recycled Materials
metrics.description: Percentage of recycled materials used to manufacture the organization's products (including packaging) during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Hazardous Waste Avoided
metrics.description: Amount of hazardous waste avoided through refurbishing, reusing, and recycling as part of delivering or developing the organization's products and services during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Waste Reductions from Services Sold
metrics.description: Amount of waste reduced during the reporting period as a result of the organization's services. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Waste Reductions from Products Sold
metrics.description: Amount of waste reduced over the lifetime of products sold by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Non-hazardous Waste Avoided
metrics.description: Amount of non-hazardous waste disposal avoided through refurbishing, reusing, and recycling as part of delivering or developing the organization's products and services during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Sustainable Procurement Policy
metrics.description: Describes the inclusion of sustainability considerations into the organization's supplier selection, evaluation and contract management. Organizations should document supporting evidence such as procurement policies, checklists, or supplier codes of conduct.

metrics.name: Type of Waste
metrics.description: Category or material composition of waste generated, managed or diverted by an organization. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Investment in Recycling Technology
metrics.description: Monetary value invested in acquiring, upgrading or developing recycling-related technologies. Organizations should disaggregate by material streams (plastic, metal, glass, paper, e-waste or organics) to provide additional insights into technology investment priorities.

metrics.name: Recycling Plant Capacity
metrics.description: Quantity of material that a recycling plant is designed to process under normal operating conditions. Organizations should document key assumptions, such as number of shifts, operating days, feedstock quality or other operational factors that may affect theoretical versus practical capacity. Organizations should separately report actual utilization rates alongside designed capacity for context, in cases where facilities operate below their technical capacity due to staffing, energy or market constraints. Organizations should report both pre-expansion and post-expansion capacity when capacity changed due to expansion, upgrades or installation of new equipment and indicate the reporting period in which these changes took effect.

metrics.name: Diverted Material Outflows
metrics.description: Mass of material that exits the organization’s operational boundary through recovery or disposal pathways, excluding primary products sold. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including the type(s) of materials produced.

metrics.name: Recovery Type
metrics.description: Method by which a product, component or material is recovered at the end of its use phase in order to retain value, extend useful life and reduce waste. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Mass of Products Recovered
metrics.description: Mass of products or product components recovered through circular strategies, such as reuse, refurbishment, remanufacturing, repair, repurpose or recycling as measured at the point of recovery. Organizations should footnote whether the product/material is recovered by the original manufacturer or the consumer brand.

metrics.name: Mass of Products Recovered via Lifetime Extension
metrics.name_kr: Mass of Products Recovered via Lifetime Extension
metrics.description: Mass of products or components recovered through lifetime extension strategies. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Input Mass to Recycling Operation
metrics.description: Mass of material that enters a recycling operation, including both recyclable and non-recyclable materials. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Mass of Input Material Converted into Usable Recycled Output
metrics.name_kr: Mass of Input Material Converted into Usable Recycled Output
metrics.description: Mass of the input material that is successfully transformed into usable recycled material. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Usable Output Mass
metrics.description: Mass of material output from recycling or processing operations that meets defined quality standards for reuse, resale or reintegration into manufacturing processes. Organizations should footnote disaggregations of their usable output by quality grade (for example, high-purity, medium-grade, low-grade materials) and intended end use (for example, food-grade, cosmetic-grade, construction or other industrial applications) to reflect differences in material quality, processing effort and potential for closed-loop recycling.

metrics.name: Outflow of Recovered Materials
metrics.description: Total mass of materials that exit the organization’s operations but are diverted from disposal with the aim of reintroducing them into value-retaining cycles. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Recyclability Status
metrics.description: Indicates whether a product, component or material has been evaluated for recyclability and classified according to its ability to be effectively recycled using existing or emerging infrastructure. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Recyclable Mass of Product
metrics.description: Total mass of recyclable components in a product. Organizations should footnote methodologies or standards applied to determine recyclability; the scope and boundaries of the measurement (for example, whether packaging, adhesives, coatings or embedded components were included); and assumptions made when estimates are applied.

metrics.name: Repair Resources
metrics.description: Number of products in the organization’s portfolio that have resources enabling repair. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Product Durability Design Features
metrics.description: Indicates whether design or manufacturing changes have been made to a product to increase its durability. Organizations should footnote: The type of design or manufacturing change introduced (for example design changes may include stronger materials, protective coatings, modular upgrades, component standardization or interchangeability or reinforced structural design; while manufacturing changes may include enhanced structural joining or barrier sealing, improved material or surface treatments, high-precision machining or finishing or process innovation methods such as additive manufacturing and advanced casting or forging). How durability was verified, whether through laboratory testing, accelerated life testing, field testing or monitoring, engineering specifications or modeling or compliance with durability standards. Whether durability improvements apply to the entire product or only to certain components.

metrics.name: Product Repairability Design Features
metrics.description: Indicates whether design or manufacturing changes have been made to a product to increase its repairability. Organizations should footnote: - The type of design or manufacturing change introduced. For example design changes may include modular component design, standardized or interchangeable parts, accessible assembly/disassembly features, tool-free access or clearly labeled components; while manufacturing changes may include precision assembly to allow easier disassembly, standardized fasteners, integration of repair-friendly joining methods or process innovations that facilitate repairability. - How repairability was verified, whether through laboratory or bench testing of disassembly/reassembly, user repair trials, engineering specifications or modeling of component access and serviceability or compliance with recognized repairability standards or scoring methods. - Whether repairability improvements apply to the entire product or only to certain components.

metrics.name: Modular Design Features
metrics.description:
Identifies the modular design features of a product. Organizations should footnote:
- Which specific modular features are present. 
- Whether modularity applies to core components only or to the full product design.
- Whether modularity enables consumer-level replacement/upgrade or is limited to authorized service providers.

metrics.name: Lifetime Extension Services
metrics.description: Indicates whether a service extends the functional life of products through lifetime extension recovery strategies. Organizations should footnote whether services are performed in-house, by third parties or through customer-facing repair programs.

metrics.name: Product Actual Lifetime
metrics.description: Average duration a product remains in functional use before being discarded, replaced or retired. This reflects the actual lifespan of the product, based on user behavior, technical durability and serviceability. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.
metrics.unit: Unit Referenced within Metric Usage Guidance

metrics.name: Stormwater Runoff
metrics.description: Volume of water generated from rain and snowmelt flowing over (that is, without soaking into the ground) land indirectly or directly controlled by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including which tools or methodologies were used to measure stormwater runoff.

metrics.name: Water Type
metrics.description:
Describes the type of water withdrawn, consumed, or discharged as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period.

Choose all that apply:
- Rainwater
- Recycled Water
- Groundwater
- Surface Water 
- Seawater
- Third Party: Municipal
- Third Party: Wastewater
- Other (describe) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Water Withdrawn
metrics.description: Volume of all water drawn from surface water, groundwater, seawater, or a third party for any use by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source(s) of data.

metrics.name: Water Discharged
metrics.description: Volume of effluents, used water, and unused water released, during the reporting period, to surface water, groundwater, seawater, or a third party and for which the organization has no further use. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source(s) of data.

metrics.name: Water Consumed: Total
metrics.description: Volume of water used for the organization's operations during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Water Consumed: Recycled
metrics.description: Volume of recycled water used for the organization's operations during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Level of Water Stress
metrics.description:
Level of baseline water stress on land directly or indirectly managed by the organization as of the end of the reporting period.

Choose all that apply: 
- Low (<10%)
- Low-medium (10–19.9%)
- Medium-high (20–39.9%)
- High (40–80%)
- Extremely high (>80%)
- Arid and low water use
- No data Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including which tools or methodologies were used to assess the level of water stress.

metrics.name: Water Consumed: Municipal
metrics.description: Volume of water drawn from municipal water sources used for the organization's operations during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Water Consumed: Regions with High Water Stress
metrics.name_kr: Water Consumed: Regions with High Water Stress
metrics.description: Volume of water used from regions with high or extremely high baseline water stress during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including how high-water-stress regions are identified, how water usage is measured in those regions, and what strategies are in place to reduce water usage in those regions. See usage guidance for additional information.

metrics.name: Stream Nutrient Levels Assessment
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization has assessed nitrogen and phosphorus levels in streams on directly or indirectly controlled land as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including which tools or methodologies were used to assess nutrient levels.

metrics.name: Stream Turbidity Level
metrics.description: Level of turbidity (in Nephelometric Turbidity Units, or NTU) observed in streams or rivers on land directly or indirectly managed by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source(s) of data.

metrics.name: Water Conserved
metrics.description: Volume of water usage reduced as a result of the organization's water conservation efforts during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Water Consumed: Groundwater
metrics.description: Volume of groundwater used for the organization's operations during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Water Consumed: Rainwater
metrics.description: Volume of rainwater used for the organization's operations during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Water Quality Practices
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization employs management practices to protect water quality. Organizations should footnote the specific details of their water quality practices.

metrics.name: Land Directly Controlled: Impervious Surfaces
metrics.description: Area of land directly controlled by the organization that is impervious to water during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source(s) of data.

metrics.name: Wastewater Treatment Compliance
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization's practices related to the discharge of wastewater comply with local legal requirements. Organizations should footnote the specific details of their wastewater management policies and any details regarding violation of local compliance.

metrics.name: Water Consumed: Surface Water

metrics.name: Client Savings Premium
metrics.description:
Percentage price savings the client obtains by purchasing a product or service from the organization and the average price that they would otherwise pay for a similar product or service in the local market. This metric is intended to capture the price discount or savings to a client of purchasing the organization’s products or services rather than a similar product or service. For example, if the organization's product costs USD 5 and the average price for a similar product is USD 10 in the local market, this would be calculated as: (USD 10 – USD 5) / USD 10 = 50% savings. Positive numbers can be interpreted as savings to the consumer (client). In this calculation, organizations should use prices as of the end of the reporting period.

In specific contexts, and based on evidence, this metric can serve as a proxy indicator of whether the outcome being sought by an investor or organization is occurring (the WHAT dimension of impact). For more on the alignment of IRIS+ metrics to the five dimensions of impact, see IRIS++ and the Five Dimensions of Impact (https://IRIS+.thegiin.org/document/IRIS+-and-the-five-dimensions/). No single metric is sufficient to understand an impact; rather, metrics are selected as a set across all dimensions of impact. When possible, the selection of metrics to measure and describe the five dimensions should be based on best practice and evidence.
