Describes the demographics of the ownership of the organization, or disaggregates another metric in terms of one or more demographic groups of ownership. Particular thresholds apply to consider an organization "owned" by members of a demographic group; see usage guidance for further information. Select all that apply:

Gender:
- 51% or Greater Female or Gender Non-Binary
- Undisclosed
- Other

Disability Status:
- Persons with disabilities
- Persons without disabilities
- Undisclosed
- Other

Race/Ethnicity/Minority Status:
- Historically marginalized groups
- Dominant culture populations
- Undisclosed

Other target populations:
- Other (describe) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data or disaggregation and any other disaggregations applied.
metrics.unit: Number of Metric Tons of CO2 Equivalent

metrics.name: Training Type
metrics.description:
Describes the types of trainings completed by individuals as a result of the organization's activities during the reporting period.

Choose all that apply:
 - Enterprise or business development training
 - Vocational or technical training
 - Anti-harassment training
 - Racial equity training
 - General social and environmental performance training
 - Undisclosed Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Founders: Female
metrics.description: Number of the organization’s founders who are female and retain an active role in the company as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Investment Committee Members: Female
metrics.description: Number of female members of the organization’s investment committee as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Product Targeted to Women
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization offers a product or service that disproportionately benefits women. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Client Organizations Led: Total
metrics.description: Number of client organizations as of the end of the reporting period in which the leader (or half or more of the leaders, if there are multiple) represents a specific group (for example, women or historically marginalized groups). Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Caregivers Employed: Responsive
metrics.description: Number of caregivers who are responsive to children's needs and who are employed by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details about the types of caregivers employed and how the organization measures responsiveness. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Teachers Employed
metrics.description: Number of full- and part-time teachers employed by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as a breakdown of full- and part-time teachers.

metrics.name: Learning Environment Quality Assessment
metrics.description: Describes whether the organization has assessed the quality of the learning environment for children or learners who used the organization's products/services as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including which tools or methodologies were used to assess the quality of the learning environment. Organizations are also encouraged to footnote details about the frequency with which they conduct such assessments.

metrics.name: Parent/Community-Teacher Engagement
metrics.description: NOTE: this metric has been discontinued. Organizations should footnote descriptive details about the engagement(s).

metrics.name: Hours of School Offered per Week
metrics.name_kr: Hours of School Offered per Week
metrics.description: Number of classroom hours offered to a representative student each week during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Days of School Offered per Year
metrics.name_kr: Days of School Offered per Year
metrics.description: Number of days of school offered by the organization each year. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Learning Hours Provided: Type
metrics.description:
Describes the type of learning time provided through the organization's products/services during the reporting period.

Choose all that apply (see usage guidance for definitions): 
- School time
- Instructional time
- Engaged time/time-on-task
- Supportive learning time
- Other (describe) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Extracurricular Programs Offered
metrics.description: Describes the extracurricular activities that the organization offers to students. Organizations should footnote details about the specific extracurricular programs provided. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Child Developmental Assessment
metrics.description: Describes whether the organization has screened children who are using the organization's products/services for developmental progress and delays as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including which tools or methodologies were used to screen children for developmental progress. Organizations are also encouraged to footnote details about the frequency with which they conduct such assessments.

metrics.name: Developmental Status
metrics.description:
Describes the developmental status of children served by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. 

Choose all that apply: 
- Developmentally on track overall
- Developmentally on track in language
- Developmentally on track in executive function
- Developmentally on track in health
- Developmentally on track in social and behavioral skills
- Developmentally delayed
- Other (describe) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including which tools or methodologies were used.

metrics.name: School Enrollment: Female
metrics.description: Number of female students enrolled as of the end of the reporting period, both full- and part-time, with each discrete student counted once regardless of their number of courses. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as a breakdown of full- and part-time female students.

metrics.name: Student Transportation
metrics.description: Indicates if the organization provided transportation to students that needed or requested it during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the type of transportation provided and the percentage of students that use it.

metrics.name: Learning Hours
metrics.description: Number of learning hours provided to students during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source(s) of data.

metrics.name: Teachers Qualified
metrics.description: Number of teachers at the organizations as of the end of the reporting period who have obtained training or have qualifications that meet or exceed the minimum requirements of the local area. Organizations should footnote the minimum level of qualifications required in the local area.

metrics.name: School Enrollment: Low Income
metrics.description: Number of low-income students enrolled as of the end of the reporting period, both full- and part-time, with each discrete student counted once regardless of their number of courses. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including details on the assessment tools used to identify low-income students. Organizations should also break down enrolled low-income students into full- and part-time. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Schooling Status
metrics.description:
Describes the schooling status of students served by the organization during the reporting period.

Choose all that apply:

Enrollment status:
- Enrolled
- Not enrolled
- Other (describe)

Grade promotion:
- Promoted to next year of schooling
- Repeated year of schooling
- Dropped out
- Graduated 
- Other (describe) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source(s) of data.

metrics.name: School Enrollment: Total
metrics.description: Number of students enrolled as of the end of the reporting period, both full- and part-time, with each discrete student counted once regardless of their number of courses. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as a breakdown of full- and part-time students.

metrics.name: School Fees
metrics.description: Average school fees per student per month during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: School Enrollment: Peri-urban
metrics.description: Number of students residing in peri-urban areas enrolled as of the end of the reporting period, both full- and part-time, with each discrete student counted once regardless of their number of courses. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as a breakdown of full- and part-time students residing in peri-urban areas.

metrics.name: Students Provided Partial Scholarship
metrics.description: Number of students receiving partial scholarships during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the details on scholarship eligibility requirements, who provides scholarship funding, average scholarship amounts as a percentage of full tuition/fees, and any other relevant details.

metrics.name: Teacher Attendance Rate
metrics.description: Rate of teacher attendance during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including details on how teacher attendance is tracked.

metrics.name: Student Attendance Rate
metrics.description: Rate of student attendance during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including details on how attendance is tracked.

metrics.name: Student to Toilet Ratio
metrics.description: Number of students per functioning toilet during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Educational Resource to Student Ratio
metrics.description: Number of textbooks or digital educational resources per student provided by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Students Provided Full Scholarship
metrics.description: Number of students receiving full scholarship during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the details on scholarship eligibility requirements, source of scholarship funding, and other relevant details.

metrics.name: Value of New Education Facility Materials
metrics.name_kr: Value of New Education Facility Materials
metrics.description: Value of new educational facility materials provided to students by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as details on the type of educational facility materials provided.

metrics.name: Percent Students Receiving Free and Subsidized School Meals
metrics.name_kr: Percent Students Receiving Free and Subsidized School Meals
metrics.description: Percentage of students receiving free and subsidized school meals as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Student Promotion Rate
metrics.description: Percentage of students advancing from one grade of schooling to the next during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as any relevant details regarding the promotion rate.

metrics.name: Student to Teacher Ratio
metrics.description: Number of students per teacher during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Classroom Area per Student
metrics.description: Area of classroom space per student during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Student to Classroom Ratio
metrics.description: Number of students per classroom during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: School Enrollment: Very Poor
metrics.description: Number of very poor students enrolled as of the end of the reporting period, both full- and part-time, with each discrete student counted once regardless of their number of courses. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including details on the assessment tools used to identify the poverty level of students. Organizations should also breakdown enrolled students into full- and part-time. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Value of New Education Instructional Materials
metrics.name_kr: Value of New Education Instructional Materials
metrics.description: Value of new educational instructional materials provided to students by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as details on the type of education instruction materials provided.

metrics.name: School Enrollment: People with Disabilities
metrics.description: Number of students with disabilities enrolled as of the end of the reporting period, both full- and part-time, with each discrete student counted once regardless of their number of courses. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as any specific focus on stakeholders with particular disabilities. Organizations should also break down enrolled students with disabilities into full- and part-time.

metrics.name: School Enrollment: Rural
metrics.description: Number of students residing in rural areas enrolled as of the end of the reporting period, both full- and part-time, with each discrete student counted once regardless of their number of courses. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. Organizations should also break down enrolled students residing in rural areas into full- and part-time.

metrics.name: School Meals
metrics.description: Number of free or subsidized meals provided by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: School Enrollment: Poor
metrics.description: Number of poor students enrolled as of the end of the reporting period, both full- and part-time, with each discrete student counted once regardless of their number of courses. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including details on the assessment tools used to identify the poverty level of students. Organizations should also break down enrolled poor students into full- and part-time. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Classroom Space New/Improved
metrics.description: Area of classroom space built, converted, or expanded for use within educational facilities during the reporting period. Report only space completed during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as details on the intended use of the completed new/improved classroom space completed.

metrics.name: School Enrollment: Historically Marginalized
metrics.description: Number of students who belong to groups historically marginalized due to race and/or ethnicity and who are enrolled as of the end of the reporting period, both full- and part-time, with each discrete student counted once regardless of their number of courses. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including their categorization of historically marginalized groups. Organizations should also break down enrolled students into full- and part-time. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Teaching Experience
metrics.description: Average number of years of formal education for teachers and instructors as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including details on how years of teaching experience are tracked.

metrics.name: School Enrollment: Urban
metrics.description: Number of students residing in urban areas enrolled as of the end of the reporting period, both full- and part-time, with each discrete student counted once regardless of their number of courses. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as a breakdown of full- and part-time students residing in urban areas.

metrics.name: Student Tests Pass Rate
metrics.description: Percentage of students at a school passing standardized tests offered by a regional governance body during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote a description of the standardized test, the threshold for passing, how many tests were taken, and other relevant details.

metrics.name: Vocational/Technical Training
metrics.description: Number of students receiving vocational or technical training during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as details about the type of vocational/technical training received by the students.

metrics.name: Average Student Test Score
metrics.description: Average test score (as a percentage of a perfect score) earned by students served by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including which tests form the basis of this calculation.

metrics.name: Student Dropout Rate
metrics.description: Percentage of students who were attending school at the beginning of the reporting period but who dropped out during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as any relevant details regarding the dropout rate.

metrics.name: Jobs Type
metrics.description:
Describes the type of jobs supported, created, maintained, or lost during the reporting period.

Choose all that apply:

Permanence: 
- Permanent 
- Temporary (seasonal or repeated) 
- Temporary (one-time) 
- Other

Hiring: 
- Jobs hired through organization itself 
- Jobs hired/supported through a third-party and directly related to the organization’s operations and maintenance 
- Jobs hired/supported through a third-party but not directly related to the organization’s operations and maintenance 
- Other

Full-Time/Part-Time: 
- Full-time 
- Part-time
- Other Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Hazard Identification Practices
metrics.description: Describes the hazard identification and risk assessment practices deployed by an organization. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Organized Informal Workers
metrics.description: Number of informal workers who are part of a recognized informal workers’ association, cooperative, union or network that gives voice to or represents their interests. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Worker Formality Status
metrics.description: Describes the employment formality status of an organization’s workforce. Organizations should footnote whether contractors or supply chain workers are included. Organizations can combine this metric with information on workforce composition by gender, age or geographic location to further improve the design of effective worker participation strategies and identify any patterns of vulnerability or exclusion.
metrics.unit: Unit Referenced within Metric Usage Guidance

metrics.name: Informal Workers
metrics.description: Number of individuals engaged in informal work within the organization. Organizations should disaggregate by gender, age group, contract type or geographic location to highlight vulnerable worker groups.

metrics.name: Employees Receiving Regular Performance and Career Development Reviews
metrics.name_kr: Employees Receiving Regular Performance and Career Development Reviews
metrics.description: Number of permanent and temporary workers who received a routine and regular performance and career development review during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Access to Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
metrics.description: Number of workers with access to appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) required for their job function within an organization. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Number of Employee Grievances Registered
metrics.description: Number of formal grievances registered by employees of the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Number of Workplace Hazards Identified
metrics.description: Number of workplace hazards identified at the organization’s worksites. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Number of Workers Under Regular Occupational Safety and Health (OSH) Surveillance or Exams
metrics.name_kr: Number of Workers Under Regular Occupational Safety and Health (OSH) Surveillance or Exams
metrics.description: Number of workers who are enrolled in and receive regular occupational safety and health (OSH) surveillance or medical examinations. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Worker Training and Transition Programs Offered
metrics.name_kr: Worker Training and Transition Programs Offered
metrics.description: Describes the skill development and employment transition support programs offered to members of an organization’s workforce. Organizations should footnote details on the training(s) provided.

metrics.name: Employees Covered by Collective Bargaining Agreements
metrics.name_kr: Employees Covered by Collective Bargaining Agreements
metrics.description: Number of employees of the organization who are covered by collective bargaining agreements. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including: Whether all employees are able to participate in collective bargaining agreements. What criteria, such as job type or length of tenure, determine which employees or groups of employees are covered by different aspects of the agreements in effect.

metrics.name: Occupational Injuries
metrics.description: Number of non-fatal occupational injuries sustained by members of an organization’s workforce. Organizations should footnote: The types of injuries sustained by employees, whether: Bone fractures; Burns, scalds and frostbites; Concussions and internal injuries; Dislocations, sprains and strains; Drownings and asphyxiations; Effects of sound, vibration and pressure; Effects of temperature extremes, light and radiation; Multiple injuries; Other not elsewhere mentioned; Poisonings and infections; Shocks; Traumatic amputations (Loss of body parts); Wounds and superficial injuries; Unspecified. Organizations should also footnote how the injuries were verified, such as through health and safety records or incident reports, human resources records or by other means. Organizations should disaggregate by gender, age, geographic location or cause of incident to improve understanding of workplace safety risks and the design of effective prevention strategies.

metrics.name: Workers Earning a Living Wage or Higher
metrics.name_kr: Workers Earning a Living Wage or Higher
metrics.description: Number of individuals in an organization's workforce earning a living wage or higher. Organizations should footnote the local living wage for the region(s) in which they operate (since the living wage varies with geography), as well as the sources on which they rely for these data. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Percent Employee Ownership
metrics.description: Percentage of the organization that is owned by individuals who are employed by the organization (full- or part-time) as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Occupational Illnesses
metrics.description: Number of occupational illnesses which affected any full-time, part-time, or temporary employees of the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Employees Earning Lowest Wage
metrics.description: Number of full-time, part-time, and temporary employees of the organization that are earning the lowest hourly wage (including bonuses, excluding benefits) paid by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. See usage guidance for further details. Organizations should footnote the lowest wage paid by the organization in each country of operation, whether it meets or exceeds the local minimum wage for the region(s) in which they operate, and any other assumptions made in calculating this metric. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Employees with Written Contracts
metrics.description: Number of employees (including both permanent and temporary workers) who had written contracts for their employment during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Employment Benefits Uptake
metrics.description: Percentage of all employees using employee benefits provided by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Number of Employee Grievances Resolved
metrics.description: Number of formal grievances registered by employees of the organization that were resolved during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Fatal Occupational Injuries
metrics.description:
Number of fatal occupational injuries sustained by members of an organization's workforce. Organizations should footnote: 
- The types of injuries sustained by employees, whether: Bone fractures; Burns, scalds and frostbites; Concussions and internal injuries; Dislocations, sprains and strains; Drownings and asphyxiations; Effects of sound, vibration and pressure; Effects of temperature extremes, light and radiation; Multiple injuries; Other not elsewhere mentioned; Poisonings and infections; Shocks; Traumatic amputations (Loss of body parts); Wounds and superficial injuries; Unspecified. 
- How the injuries were verified, such as through health and safety records or incident reports, human resources records or by other means. 
- Disaggregation by gender, age, role, geographic location or cause of incidents is encouraged to improve understanding of workplace safety risks and the design of effective prevention strategies.

metrics.name: Job Placements
metrics.description: Number of the organization's clients who were placed in part-time, full-time, temporary, or permanent jobs during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Total Personal Connectivity Devices
metrics.description: Average number of connectivity devices utilized in each client household during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions, including source of data.

metrics.name: Provided New Access
metrics.description:
Describes the type of prior access in a market available to an organization's clients, or disaggregates another metric in terms of type of prior access available in a market.

Select any that apply by impact theme:

Clean Energy
- Previously accessed ‘dirty’ energy
- Previously lacked any energy access
- Previously accessed less efficient energy
- Did not previously lack clean energy access
- Other (write-in)

Other
- Write-in Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data or disaggregation and any other disaggregations applied.
metrics.unit: Number of Metric Tons of CO2 Equivalent

metrics.name: Loans Receivable Net
metrics.description: Net value of the organization's loans receivable as of the end of the reporting period.

metrics.name: Loan to Deposit (LTD) Ratio
metrics.description: Ratio between the organization's loans receivable gross and its total deposits as of the end of the reporting period, used to assess an organization's liquidity.

metrics.name: Capital Available: Total
metrics.description: Value of capital available to the organization for lending and investing as of the end of the reporting period.

metrics.name: Impairment Loss Allowance
metrics.description: Value of the organization’s contra asset account set up as a provision for a potential future loss of capital that has been lent out by the organization as of the end of the reporting period.

metrics.name: Gross Incurred Claims
metrics.description: Value of the organization’s gross incurred claims as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Financial Expenses
metrics.description: Value of expenditures incurred by the organization during the reporting period to settle interest, fees, and commissions incurred on the organization’s financial liabilities—including, among others, any client deposit accounts held by the organization, borrowings, and subordinated debt.

metrics.name: Loans Receivable Gross
metrics.description: Value of outstanding principal for all of the organization’s outstanding loans due from clients as of the end of the reporting period.

metrics.name: Non-Performing Loans (Portfolio at Risk): 30 Days
metrics.description: Value of the organization’s loans outstanding, as of the end of the reporting period, with one or more installments of principal past due for more than 30 days.

metrics.name: Capital Available: Borrowed Funds
metrics.description: Value of capital available to the organization for lending and investing as of the end of the reporting period that is attributed to debt obligations on the organization’s balance sheet.

metrics.name: Loans Recovered
metrics.description: Value of loans collected by the organization during the reporting period that had previously been written off.

metrics.name: Capital Available: Equity Capital
metrics.description: Value of capital available to the organization for lending and investing at the end of the reporting period that is attributed to equity contributions.

metrics.name: Number of Loans Fully Repaid on Time
metrics.name_kr: Number of Loans Fully Repaid on Time
metrics.description: Number of the organization’s loans due for complete payback during the reporting period (but disbursed at any time) that were repaid no later than their due dates. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Solvency Ratio
metrics.description: Ratio of an organization’s admitted assets to liabilities, per their statutory accounts, as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details about their admitted assets. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Non-Performing Loans (Portfolio at Risk): 60 Days
metrics.description: Value of the organization’s loans outstanding, as of the end of the reporting period, with one or more installments of principal past due for more than 60 days.

metrics.name: Non-Performing Loans (Portfolio at Risk): 90 Days
metrics.description: Value of the organization’s loans outstanding, as of the end of the reporting period, with one or more installments of principal past due for more than 90 days.

metrics.name: Incurred Claims Ratio
metrics.description: Percentage of gross incurred claims during the reporting period relative to gross earned premiums during the same reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Total Deposits
metrics.description: Value of the organization’s customer deposits, whether voluntary, compulsory, demand, or term, as well as all other liabilities from customers as of the end of the reporting period.

metrics.name: Loan Write-Offs
metrics.description: Value of loans written off by the organization during the reporting period.

metrics.name: Value of Loans Fully Repaid on Time
metrics.name_kr: Value of Loans Fully Repaid on Time
metrics.description: Value of the organization’s loans due for complete payback during the reporting period (but disbursed at any time) that were repaid no later than their due dates.

metrics.name: Value of Investments in Company: Outstanding
metrics.name_kr: Value of Investments in Company: Outstanding
metrics.description: Value of the investing organization's outstanding investment in a company as of the end of the reporting period. See usage guidance for details. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Type of Financial Institution
metrics.description:
Describes what type of financial institution the organization is, if applicable. Select all that apply:

- Community Action Agency (CAA)
- Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI)
- Credit Union/Cooperative
- Loan Fund, including microenterprise fund or Multibank Community Development Corporation (CDC)
- Non-Banking Financial Institution/Non-Banking Financial Corporation (NBFI/NBFC)
- Non-Profit/Non-Governmental Organization, including Community Development Corporation (CDCs)
- Rural Bank
- Thrift, Bank, Bank Holding Company
- Venture Capital Fund
- Other Organizations should footnote their type of financial institution if they select “Other.”

metrics.name: Loan Officers Employed
metrics.description: Number of loan officers employed by the organization as of the end of the reporting period.

metrics.name: Social and Environmental Performance Incentives
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization implemented any employee incentive schemes related to social and/or environmental performance goals during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the types of social performance indicators used to incentivize employees and details on which employees qualify. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Loan Officer Wages
metrics.description: Value of wages (including bonuses) paid to loan officers during the reporting period.

metrics.name: Social Responsibility Client Policies
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization implements policies to protect its clients. Organizations should footnote details on the types of policies implemented. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Interest Rate Method
metrics.description:
Describes the method(s) used by the organization to state the interest rate of its products. Select all that apply:

- Declining balance method
- Flat interest method Organizations that use multiple methods should footnote the products to which each method applies.

metrics.name: Weighted Average Tenor of Loans Outstanding
metrics.name_kr: Weighted Average Tenor of Loans Outstanding
metrics.description: Weighted average tenor of loans outstanding on the organization’s balance sheet as of the end of the reporting period, measured in months. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Other Financial Services Offered
metrics.description: Describes the types of financial services the organization offers in addition to core credit, savings, and insurance products. Organizations should footnote details on these additional service offerings and their uptake. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Savings Account Incentives
metrics.description: Describes the types of incentives the organization offers to clients to establish savings accounts. Organizations should footnote details on the types of incentives provided.

metrics.name: Microfinance Delivery Methodology
metrics.description:
Describes the methodologies the organization uses to deliver financial services. Select all that apply:

- Individual lending
- Solidarity group lending
- Village/self-help group lending
- Digital financial services
- Agency banking
- Licensed agents working on behalf of the financial service provider
- Roving staff/mobile branches
- ATMs
- Mobile banking
- Internet-based services
- Merchant POS or network
- Other Organizations selecting ‘Other’ should footnote the type of delivery methodology they use.

metrics.name: Environmental Policies for Financial Services Clients
metrics.name_kr: Environmental Policies for Financial Services Clients
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization implements environmental policies associated with the organization’s financing practices. Organizations should footnote details on the types of policies implemented. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Compulsory Deposits
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization requires clients to establish savings accounts. Organizations should footnote the details of this requirement, including which clients it applies to.

metrics.name: Non-financial Support Offered
metrics.description: Describes the type of non-financial support the organization offers to clients, if applicable. Organizations should footnote details regarding the types of services offered and their uptake. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Responsible Financial Products/Services Offered
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization offers responsible financial products and services. See usage guidance for further information. Organizations should footnote details regarding the policies in place that make the offered financial products and services responsible. Organizations may refer to footnotes under other reported metrics.

metrics.name: Renewal Ratio
metrics.description: Percentage of the organization’s clients that stay enrolled in policies after their coverage term expires during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Number of Loans Outstanding
metrics.description: Number of disbursed loans remaining on the organization’s balance sheet as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Account Value
metrics.description:
Disaggregates a metric representing accounts in terms of the direction of their change in value during the reporting period.

Select any that apply:
- Increased in value during the reporting period
- Decreased in value or stayed the same value during the reporting period
- Other (write-in) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data or disaggregation and any other disaggregations applied.

metrics.name: Number of Equity Investments Outstanding
metrics.description: Number of equity investments on the organization’s balance sheet as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Average Insurance Premium
metrics.description: Average annualized insurance premium charged for a particular insurance product provided by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Gross Earned Premium
metrics.description: Value of premium earned by the organization as of the end of the reporting period, without any deductions for commissions or other expenses. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Promptness of Claims Submission
metrics.description: Average number of days elapsed between the occurrence of an insured incident and the submission of a complete claim by the stakeholder (client of the organization) for all claims settled during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Number of Complaints Registered
metrics.description: Number of complaints registered by clients of the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Number of Potential Renewals
metrics.description: Number of policies belonging to the organization’s clients that could have been renewed during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote specific criteria resulting in expired policies’ ineligibility, as well as all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Number of Renewals
metrics.description: Number of policies belonging to the organization’s clients that were renewed during the reporting period after the coverage term expired. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Value of Voluntary Savings Accounts
metrics.description: Value of voluntary savings accounts managed by the organization, including demand deposits and time deposits, as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Claims Rejected
metrics.description: Number of claims submitted to the organization that were rejected during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as the reasons for rejecting claims. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Minimum Insurance Premium
metrics.description: Minimum annualized insurance premium offered for the insurance product provided by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Value of Equity Investments Closed
metrics.description: Value of equity investments closed by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: New Businesses Created: Total
metrics.description: Number of new businesses created as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Repayment Capacity Analysis
metrics.description: Indicates whether the organization conducts repayment capacity analyses for its clients. Organizations should footnote details on the analyses conducted. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Number of Equity Investments Closed
metrics.description: Number of equity investments closed by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Average Loan Size Disbursed
metrics.description: Average loan size disbursed by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Complaints Ratio
metrics.description: Number of complaints registered per client of the reporting organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Value of Loans Disbursed
metrics.description: Value of loans disbursed by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: New Businesses Created: Low Income Areas
metrics.name_kr: New Businesses Created: Low Income Areas
metrics.description: Number of new businesses created in low-income areas as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including how they identify low-income areas. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Number of Voluntary Savings Accounts
metrics.description: Number of voluntary savings accounts managed by the organization, including demand deposits and time deposits, as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Effective Interest Rate (EIR)
metrics.description: Value of the effective interest rate (EIR) for the organization’s most representative loan product during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Value of Loans Outstanding
metrics.description: Value of disbursed loans remaining on the organization's balance sheet at the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Claims Rejection Ratio
metrics.description: Percentage of claims made by clients of the organization that were rejected during the reporting period relative to the total claims submitted to the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Value of Equity Investments Outstanding
metrics.description: Value of equity investments on the organization's balance sheet at the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Active Use
metrics.description:
Disaggregates another metric in terms of active use. For example, Client Individuals (PI4060) disaggregated by this metric, option "active," would yield Active Users in many contexts. See usage guidance for further information.

Select one:
- Active
- Inactive
- Data not available
- Other (write-in) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of disaggregation and any other disaggregations applied.

metrics.name: Claims Submitted
metrics.description: Number of claims submitted to the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Responsible Financial Products/Services Offered
metrics.description:
Describes the use of the financial product/service provided by the organization, or disaggregates another metric in terms of one or more financial product or service. For loans, this is often called "loan type."

Select any that apply:

Basic Services
- Mortgage
- Home equity
- Education
- Green financing
- Lease financing
- Emergency
- Group lending
- Other (write-in)

Business
- Working capital
- Asset financing
- Term loans
- Invoice financing
- Other (write-in)

metrics.name: Number of Loans Disbursed
metrics.description: Number of loans disbursed by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Promptness of Claims Processing
metrics.description: Average number of days elapsed between the submission of a completed claim by a stakeholder (client of the organization) and their receipt of payment or claim denial, for all claims settled during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Active Borrowers per Loan Officer
metrics.description: Number of active borrowers (clients) per loan officer at the organization as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Promptness of Claims Settlement
metrics.description: Average number of days elapsed between the occurrence of an insured incident and the receipt of payment or claim denial by the stakeholder (client of the organization), for all claims settled (or rejected) during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, as well as the details of the schedule of claims settlement (since an acceptable timeline can vary by geography). See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Records System
metrics.description: Describes the system used by a facility or service for record keeping, including whether it is paper-based or electronic, as of the end of the reporting period. Organization should footnote the details on the records system, including whether information stored is shared with target stakeholders themselves.

metrics.name: Caregivers Employed: Professionals
metrics.description: Number of caregiver professionals with current licenses or certifications, based on local requirements, employed by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details about the types of caregiver professionals employed. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Caregivers Employed: Total
metrics.description: Number of caregivers with current licenses, certifications, or trainings, based on local requirements, employed by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details about the types of caregivers employed. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Gross Written Premium
metrics.description: Amount of total insurance premium written or sold by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.
metrics.unit: Number of Metric Tons of CO2 Equivalent

metrics.name: Healthcare Facilities
metrics.description: Number of healthcare units/facilities under the organization's management as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Disease/Condition Addressed
metrics.description:
Describes the diseases or conditions addressed by the organization's products or services provided during the reporting period. Select all that apply:

- 01 Certain infectious or parasitic diseases
- 02 Neoplasms
- 03 Diseases of the blood or blood-forming organs
- 04 Diseases of the immune system
- 05 Endocrine, nutritional, or metabolic diseases
- 06 Mental, behavioural or neurodevelopmental disorders
- 07 Sleep-wake disorders
- 08 Diseases of the nervous system
- 09 Diseases of the visual system
- 10 Diseases of the ear or mastoid process
- 11 Diseases of the circulatory system
- 12 Diseases of the respiratory system
- 13 Diseases of the digestive system
- 14 Diseases of the skin
- 15 Diseases of the musculoskeletal system or connective tissue
- 16 Diseases of the genitourinary system
- 17 Conditions related to sexual health
- 18 Pregnancy, childbirth, or the puerperium
- 19 Certain conditions originating in the perinatal period
- 20 Developmental anomalies
- 21 Symptoms, signs or clinical findings, not elsewhere classified
- 22 Injury, poisoning or certain other consequences of external causes
- 23 External causes of morbidity or mortality
- 24 Factors influencing health status or contact with health services
- 25 Codes for special purposes
- 26 Supplementary Chapter Traditional Medicine Conditions - Module I Organizations should footnote details about how their products and services address the selected diseases or conditions. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Child Stunting Prevalence
metrics.description: Ratio of children within the area served by the organization who experienced stunting as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data.

metrics.name: Quality Assurance Mechanism
metrics.description:
Describes the quality assurance mechanisms that were in place at the organization during the reporting period. Select all that apply:

- Peer review/supervision
- Audit and feedback
- Checklists and logs
- Electronic monitoring systems
- Communication and education strategies
- Guidelines, protocols, and registries
- Other Organizations should footnote details and descriptions of the mechanisms used (especially if selecting ‘Other’) and how they are linked to quality-improvement activities and plans. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Healthcare Crude Coverage
metrics.description: Percentage of the organization's clients (patients) who received necessary health intervention(s) during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the expected time frame and clinical protocols that define a completed treatment, in addition to all other assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Patients Completing Treatment
metrics.description: Number of patients who successfully completed the clinically recommended course of a health intervention during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the expected time frame and clinical protocols that define a completed treatment, in addition to all other assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Critical Equipment/Facility Utilization Rate
metrics.description: Utilization rate of an identified critical piece of equipment or facility during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the specific critical equipment or facility, as well as all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Patients Screened
metrics.description: Number of patients screened for medical conditions, illnesses, or risk factors during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details on screenings completed, in addition to all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Healthcare Effective Coverage
metrics.description: Percentage of the organization's clients (patients) who received necessary health intervention(s) during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the expected time frame and clinical protocols that define a completed treatment, in addition to all other assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.
metrics.unit: Number of Metric Tons of CO2 Equivalent

metrics.name: Target Stakeholder Spending: Health
metrics.description:
Describes a target stakeholder's health spending as a share of their income or expenditures, or disaggregates another metric in terms of health spending as a share of income or expenditures. Select one: 
- Below 10%
- 10–25%
- Greater than 25% Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data.

metrics.name: Vehicle/Container Inactive Hours
metrics.description: Average number of hours spent inactive or waiting (inclusive of turnaround and dwell time) by a vehicle or container during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data and specific transportation context.

metrics.name: Bulk Cargo Handled
metrics.description: Volume of bulk cargo transported through a road, railway, port, or airport during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data and specific means of transport.

metrics.name: Number of Containers Handled
metrics.description: Number twenty-foot equivalent units (TEUs) of cargo containers transported by a road, railway, port, or airport during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data and specific means of transport.

metrics.name: Meter Type
metrics.description:
Describes the type of meter provided to households or individuals with utility connections as a result of the organization's activities during the reporting period.

Choose all that apply:

- Operating meter
- Non-operating/broken meter
- No meter
- Undisclosed Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Individuals Displaced: Total
metrics.description: Number of individuals displaced as a result of projects supported/financed by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Units/Volume Sold: Lost/Leaked
metrics.description: Amount of the product/service provided by the organization for free as a result of loss or leakage during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Vehicle Distance Traveled
metrics.description: Distance traveled by vehicles owned, operated, or sold by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data.

metrics.name: Service Hours Interrupted
metrics.description: Number of hours-of-service interruptions during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Individuals Displaced: Compensated
metrics.description: Number of individuals displaced as a result of projects supported/financed by the organization who were compensated for their displacement during the reporting period. Organizations should include type and amount of compensation in footnotes. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Service Interruptions
metrics.description: Number of service interruptions experienced by clients during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Length of Road Built or Improved
metrics.name_kr: Length of Road Built or Improved
metrics.description: Length of road built or improved by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data.

metrics.name: Service Hours Provided
metrics.description: Number of hours of service provided during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Percent Baggage Damaged or Lost
metrics.description: Percentage of baggage handled by the organization that is damaged, or that has contents damaged or lost, during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Average Vehicle Speed
metrics.description: Average speed of vehicles on roads, waterways, or in flight during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data.

metrics.name: Number of Routes Served
metrics.description: Number of directly connected port pairs or routes served during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Service Area Population
metrics.description: Number of individuals within the organization's service area (municipality, administrative region, or other geographic boundary) as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source(s) of data and the boundaries of the service area.

metrics.name: Target Stakeholder Injuries
metrics.description: Number of injuries of the organization's target stakeholders during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Target Stakeholder Fatalities
metrics.description: Number of fatalities of the organization's target stakeholders during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details about each fatality, as well as plans on how to prevent similar fatalities in the future.

metrics.name: Space Per Passenger
metrics.description: Amount of space per passenger (in an airport, passenger port, or vehicle) during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source of data.

metrics.name: Climate Resilient Water Management Practices
metrics.description: Describes the type of climate resilient water management practices carried out by an organization during a reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, and deploy evidence led strategies in selection, facilitation and implementation of climate resilient water management practices, accounting for maladaptation.

metrics.name: Level of Flood Risk
metrics.description:
Describes the flood risk level(s) of the region(s) and communities targeted by the organization during the reporting period. 

Choose all that apply: 
- Low Risk
- Low-Moderate Risk
- Moderate Risk
- High-Moderate Risk
- High Risk
- Undetermined Risk Organizations should footnote all assumptions used including source of data.

metrics.name: Adaptation Needs Assessment
metrics.description: Describes the specific adaptation needs of the region targeted by the organization. The adaptation needs can be described by a list of actions and resources required to complete all stages of adaptation process that respond to the specific climate shocks in the short and long term, starting with the specific climate vulnerability of the region and community targeted. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Flood Resilient Construction Practices
metrics.description: Describes specific flood resilience construction practices made to the housing units, buildings, infrastructure and surrounding areas. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Technology Type
metrics.description:
Describes the type(s) of technologies provisioned, enabled, or adopted by an organization or their clients or communities served, during a reporting period. 

Choose all that apply: 
- Information and Communication Technology
   - Internet of Things (IoT)
   - Artificial Intelligence (AI)
   - Big Data Analytics
   - Blockchain
- Renewable Energy Technology:
   - Solar Power
   - Wind Power
   - Hydropower
- Climate Technology:
   - Precision Agriculture
   - Early warning systems
   - Remote Sensing
   - Biodiversity Monitoring
   - Waste Management
   - Water Treatment
   - Recycling
   - Adaptation and resilience
- Transportation Technology:
   - Electric Vehicles (EVs)
   - Autonomous Vehicles
- Healthcare Technology:
   - Telemedicine
   - Medical Imaging
   - Biotechnology
- Construction and Infrastructure Technology:
   - 3D Printing
   - Smart Buildings
- Financial Technology (Fintech):
   - Mobile Payments
   - Peer-to-Peer Lending
- Educational Technology (EdTech):
   - Learning Management Systems (LMS)
   - Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR)
   - Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS) Technologies:
   - Direct Air Capture
   - Carbon Sequestration
- Other (Describe) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Climate Vulnerability Status
metrics.description:
Describes the degree to which natural, built, or human systems are at risk of exposure to climate change impacts.

Choose all that apply:
- High
- Medium
- Low Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Damage to Infrastructure
metrics.description: Describes the projected loss of value of infrastructure due to climate change, disasters, or extreme weather events. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used including source of data.

metrics.name: Value of Community Infrastructure
metrics.description: Describes the value of natural or built infrastructure accessed, managed or owned by the community for collective wellbeing, that are built new, repaired or upgraded by the organization. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used including source of data.

metrics.name: Setting of Housing/Community Facilities
metrics.description:
Describes the setting of community development facilities or housing units projected to be constructed or preserved as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period.

Choose all that apply:

- Urban
- Rural
- Peri-urban
- Other Organizations should footnote details and descriptions of the types and locations of community development or housing units constructed or preserved (especially if selecting "Other").

metrics.name: Housing Type
metrics.description:
Describes the type of housing units projected to be constructed or preserved as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period.

Choose all that apply:

Rent or Sale: 
- Rent
- Sale

Number of bedrooms: 
- Studio
- 1-Bedroom
- 2-Bedroom
- 3-Bedroom
- 4-Bedroom
- 5-Bedroom
- Other Organizations should footnote details and descriptions of the types of housing units constructed or preserved (especially if selecting "Other").

metrics.name: Percent Affordable Housing
metrics.description: Percentage of the housing units projected to be constructed or preserved as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period that are considered affordable housing. Organizations should footnote the assumptions used in defining affordable housing. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Community Facilities Type
metrics.description:
Describes the type of community development facilities projected to be built, renovated, or purchased as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period.

Choose all that apply:

- Childcare
- Education
- Healthcare
- Other Organizations should footnote details and descriptions of these facilities (especially if selecting "Other").

metrics.name: Target Stakeholder Spending: Housing
metrics.description: Amount of money spent by the average target stakeholder on housing costs during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the type of expenditures made, including whether payments are for rent or ownership of housing, as well as all assumptions used and source of data.

metrics.name: Building Area of Energy Efficiency Improvements
metrics.name_kr: Building Area of Energy Efficiency Improvements
metrics.description: Area of buildings projected to receive energy-efficiency improvements as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details on the types of energy efficiency improvements planned, as well as all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Value of Community Facilities Financed
metrics.description: Value of community facilities projected to be built, renovated, or purchased as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Number of Housing Units Constructed
metrics.description: Number of housing units constructed by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Individuals Housed
metrics.description: Number of individuals projected to be housed in single- or multi-family dwellings as a result of new construction, loans, repairs, or remodeling resulting from investments made by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Area of Community Facilities Financed
metrics.description: Area of community facilities projected to be constructed or preserved as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including what spaces they include in their calculations of area. See usage guidance for further information.

metrics.name: Number of Housing Units Financed
metrics.description: Number of housing units projected to be constructed or preserved as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Value of Commercial or Retail Infrastructure Financed
metrics.name_kr: Value of Commercial or Retail Infrastructure Financed
metrics.description: Value of commercial or retail infrastructure projected to be built or renovated as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Number of Housing Units Improved
metrics.description: Number of housing units improved or refurbished by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Eviction Rate
metrics.description: Percentage of permanent tenants involuntarily removed from housing units during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote the reasons for each eviction and where individuals transitioned (e.g., shelters, other supportive housing structures, other, or unknown). Organizations should also footnote any assumptions used.

metrics.name: Value of Housing Units Financed
metrics.description: Value of housing projected to be constructed or preserved as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Number of Community Facilities Financed
metrics.description: Number of community facilities projected to be built, renovated, or purchased as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Client Housing Quality Satisfaction
metrics.description: NOTE: This metric has been discontinued. Please use Target Stakeholder Satisfaction Score (PI7163). Organizations should footnote all assumptions made.

metrics.name: Area of Buildings Reused
metrics.description: Area of buildings projected to be renovated or remodeled for building reuse as a result of investments made by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote details on why the renovated or remodeled building areas qualify for reuse.

metrics.name: Wastewater Removed
metrics.description: Volume of wastewater safely removed from client premises by the organization during the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Connection Type
metrics.description:
Describes the type of connection provided to households or individuals as a result of the organization's activities during the reporting period. 

Choose all that apply:
- Piped water
- Sewer
- Grid electricity
- Off-grid electricity
- Internet
- Phone: Mobile
- Phone: Landline
- Other (describe) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: WASH Facilities Type
metrics.description:
Describes the type of water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) facilities available on-site as a result of the organization's activities during the reporting period.

Choose all that apply: 
- Drinking water facilities
- Handwashing facilities
- Menstrual hygiene waste disposal
- Sanitation facilities
- Other (describe) Organizations should footnote all assumptions used.

metrics.name: Public Water Point Coverage
metrics.description: Number of individuals within a coverage region (defined by a municipality, district, or designated service area) who have primary water access through a public tap as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including the bounds of the municipality, district, or service area. For this purpose, organizations should report Client State/Province/Region (PD6806).

metrics.name: Number of Individual Connections
metrics.description: Number of connections to utilities and services provided to individuals by the organization as of the end of the reporting period.

metrics.name: Number of Household and Business Connections
metrics.name_kr: Number of Household and Business Connections
metrics.description: Number of residential and commercial connections to utilities and services provided by the organization as of the end of the reporting period. Organizations should footnote all assumptions used, including source(s) of data.
